bibl.title: Letter from Elizabeth Peabody to Philip Showalter Hench, December 9, 1940

div1.p: Peabody thanks Hench for his letter telling them about the Washington and Jefferson College event. They have received programs and a telegram from Hutchison. She sends a list of her father's yellow fever slides.

div1.head: Letter from Elizabeth Peabody to Philip Showalter Hench, December 9, 1940
div1.opener:
Wilson College
Chambersburg, Pa.
December 9, 1940.
DEPARTMENT OF BIOLOGY
Dr. Philip S. Hench,
Mayo Clinic,
Rochester, Minnesota.
My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
Thank you for your letter concerning the exer-
cises at Washington and Jefferson. About ten min-
utes after the arrival of your letter, I received a
most cordial telegram from President Hutchison. We
were indeed sorry that previous engagements pre-
vented our going. Dr Hutchison was good enough to
send programs so that we have a fair idea of the
interest and range of the activities. We are look-
ing forward to receiving a copy of your paper so
that we may see the new discoveries you made. It
will probably make us sadder than ever that we were not
there to see you tell about them in person.

I am enclosing a list of the slides which my
father turned over to me last year. I have tried
to put them in order as they might be used for a
lecture based more or less on his “The Conquest of
Yellow Fever.” I presume that you have many or all
of them. I apologize for not getting them to you
before this. This busy academic life!
